Description:
Detects the modification of an existing service in order to execute an arbitrary payload when the service is started or killed as a potential method for persistence.

Author: Sreeman
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Existing Service Tampering
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((command like '%sc %' and command like '%config %' and command like '%binpath=%') and (command like '%sc %' and command like '%failure%' and command like '%command=%')) or ((command like '%.sh%' or command like '%.exe%' or command like '%.dll%' or command like '%.bin$%' or command like '%.bat%' or command like '%.cmd%' or command like '%.js%' or command like '%.msh$%' or command like '%.reg$%' or command like '%.scr%' or command like '%.ps%' or command like '%.vb%' or command like '%.jar%' or command like '%.pl%') and ((command like '%reg %' and command like '%add %' and command like '%failurecommand%') and (command like '%reg %' and command like '%add %' and command like '%imagepath%'))))
